info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 15 at 7:01PM CDT until April 15 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR EASTERN ST. CLAIR COUNTY... At 701 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located over New Athens, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern St. Clair County, including the following locations... Paderborn, St. Libory, Fayetteville, Lenzburg , and Summerfield. This includes Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 23 and 27. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
